intents.description: Clarify the blend of capabilities the program must train (general conditioning, hybrid strength-cardio, functional athleticism) to set session emphasis.

experience_modifiers.beginner: Frame outcomes in accessible language (feeling fitter, keeping up with life demands).
experience_modifiers.intermediate: Encourage awareness of balance between strength, conditioning, and skill.
experience_modifiers.advanced: Surface competitive or benchmark-driven targets (e.g., CrossFit Open, gym testing).

applicability_conditions: Always relevant for functional or general conditioning goals.
Use when goal language mixes strength and cardio aims.

intents.description: Understand which movement quality or mobility gaps the plan should address so exercises build usable range and stability.

experience_modifiers.beginner: Ask about everyday movements that feel stiff or limited.
experience_modifiers.intermediate: Tie movement focus to recurring tightness or fatigue in specific patterns.
experience_modifiers.advanced: Explore high-skill positions that require mobility stability (overhead, deep squats, gymnastics).

applicability_conditions: Prioritize when the goal references holistic fitness, resilience, or reducing aches.
Include when past injuries or mobility limits are mentioned.

intents.description: Identify conditioning styles that must feature in programming (HIIT, circuits, steady state) to deliver the desired adaptations.

experience_modifiers.beginner: Discuss enjoyable cardio formats or class types.
experience_modifiers.intermediate: Balance varied conditioning intensities to avoid burnout.
experience_modifiers.advanced: Dial into energy system emphasis for competitive functional fitness demands.

applicability_conditions: Use when goal mentions metabolic conditioning, classes, or time-efficient workouts.
Optional if goal is strictly strength without cardio elements.

intents.description: Capture available tools and environments (kettlebells, sleds, classes, outdoor spaces) so every prescribed session is feasible.
applicability_conditions: Always relevantâ€”functional training often depends on diverse equipment options.
Include travel or class access patterns if mentioned.

intents.description: Understand lifestyle drivers (session length, stress relief, class cadence) that the plan must respect when setting frequency and session structure.

experience_modifiers.beginner: Discuss schedule realities and preferred session length.
experience_modifiers.intermediate: Explore weekly rhythms balancing work, family, and training.
experience_modifiers.advanced: Link training cadence to competitive seasons or peak periods.

applicability_conditions: Include when the goal references busy schedule, needing accountability, or holistic wellness.
Optional if detailed scheduling info already captured elsewhere.
